item.description: Traffic - Hydrant ; INC#0078; 01:30AM; 1508 S Alameda St; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/r2eJMbYqmVJwbz459?g_st=ic; Downtown; Traffic collision caused a sheared hydrant which firefighters are unable to shut down and require LA DWP to do so. The water is heavily impacting a small commercial building at 1601 Alameda and causing significant structural damage. There are no reported injuries at this time. LAFD will remain onscene attempting to slow the flow of water until DWP arrive. Questions regarding the collision are referred to LAPD Inc# 0243. No further details. ; FS 17; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E17 RA17 T9; CH4; 13; Margaret Stewart

Traffic - Multi-Casualty Incident; INC#0048; 01:51AM; 2193 W Washington Bl; MAP: https://goo.gl/maps/GvjWfyNvTv1pNtZk7; Harvard Heights; 9-1-1 call received at 12:42AM for a three car collision at the end of LAPD pursuit. A total of six patients were transported: 20yo F and 20yo M in critical condition. 15yo M, 14yo F, 14yo M and 22yo F all with non-life threatening injuries. As opposed to information initially received, there were no pedestrians involved. All questions regarding the collision are referred to LAPD Inc# 0105. No further details.; FS 26; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 E13 E226 E26 E29 EM11 HR3 RA13 RA15 RA26 RA29 RA34 RA826 T26; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0731; 12:21PM; 12650 W Oxnard St; MAP: https://goo.gl/maps/2z2rVGSaAUtfQ55i9; #ValleyGlen; 38 Firefighters took just 15 minutes in a well-coordinated offensive fire attack, to access, confine and fully extinguish primarily exterior/attic fire above the uppermost floor at the rear of a three-story apartment building (2 occupied floors over subterranean parking). No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 102; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E273 E278 E39 E60 E86 RA39 RA839 T73 T78; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0731; 12:06PM; 12650 W Oxnard St; MAP: https://goo.gl/maps/2z2rVGSaAUtfQ55i9; #ValleyGlen; PRELIM: Offensive firefight, with heavy smoke showing from the uppermost floor/attic at the rear of a three-story apartment building (2 occupied floors over subterranean parking); FS 102; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E273 E278 E39 E60 E86 RA39 RA839 T73 T78 ; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0089; 01:14AM; 2341 E Sheridan St; Boyle Heights; One-story single-family home with heavy smoke showing. The first 34 firefighters took 19 minutes to extinguish the flames, without injury. Cause under investigation. ; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E1 E2 E201 E202 E203 E25 RA4 T1 T2 T3; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Multi-Patient Shooting; INC#1638; 10:14PM; 130 W 76th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3F0iN8S; #Florence; Three patients total (18M, 16F, and 15F) with gunshot wounds to one or more extremities were transported in moderate condition to local hospitals by LAFD Firefighter/Paramedics. Unknown affiliations/circumstances.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E233 E264 E33 E57 EM13 RA246 RA257 RA46 RA64 RA833 RA857 T33 T64; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#1303; 06:35PM; 24399 W Vanowen St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Yl4Fh1; #WestHills; Firefighters located a stranded hiker, unable to get back to her vehicle with her canine. LAFD Air Ops hoisted the woman and her canine from a remote area near the Cave of Munits, on or near a cliff, and transferred her to firefighters on the ground who evaluated her, found no injuries or illness, and assisted her back to her vehicle. Nothing further. ; FS 105; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC17 E105 E305 H2 H4 HA2 HA4 RA106 RH114 T105; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0776; 12:58PM; 1598 Bienveneda Ave; #PacificPalisades; Hikers found an adult male unresponsive on the ground on or near a trail. LAFD Emergency Dispatchers provided instructions to multiple bystanders who took turns providing CPR. After Firefighters/Paramedics arrived, they took over resuscitative measures for approximately 20 minutes, but sadly, the man was beyond medical help and declared dead at the scene. LAFD is now working with LAPD and Coroner to determine the next steps. ; FS 69; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 E23 E269 E69 H2 H4 HA2 HA4 RA69 RH214 T69; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0645; 11:45AM; 4700 N Griffin Av; #MontecitoHeights; One adult male patient became injured after sustaining a fall in a remote location, and will be hoisted and transported by LAFD Aircraft to a local hospital. Nothing further.; FS 12; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AO1 AO2 BC2 BP47 E12 E212 E44 H2 H4 HA2 HA4 RA12 RH114 T12; CH7; 14; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0573; 10:45AM; 1671 W Michael Ln; #PacificPalisades; An approximately 65-year-old male became stranded while on a remote hiking trail. Although uninjured, he was isolated by the terrain, unable to ascend or descend from his location. LAFD Air Operations hoisted him from the remote location and brought him to a location where paramedics evaluated him as a precaution. No hospital transport required. Nothing further.; FS 23; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO1 AO2 BC9 E23 E269 E69 H2 H4 HA2 HA4 RA23 RA69 RH114 T69; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange
